title: How can humans get Wolbachia, the bacteria? - Quora

response.answer_text: Humans have been exposed to Wolbachia for thousands of years. Wolbachia are extremely common in the environment naturally infecting a large range of insect species including pests of stored food products as well as insects that bite humans such as nuisance mosquitoes like Aedes albopictus and Culex quinquefasciatus.

Are you concerned about getting infected with Wolbachia? You can relax. There is no indication that this bacterium can infect humans. Symbiosis Comes of Age at the 10th Biennial Meeting of Wolbachia Researchers
I don’t think they can, except that they can be infected with parasites which are themselves infected with wolbachia, such as filarial nematodes.
